messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Oh my
messages.msgSnippet: i have a 14 year old son that just is crazy for harry potter,if it has harry potter on it he has it,you can not see the wall,celling,or floor in his room,all
messages.messageBody:
i have a 14 year old son that just is crazy for harry potter,if it has harry potter on it he has it,you can not see the wall,celling,or floor in his room,all you see is happry potter,oh and also his curtains and bedcovers are harry potter,he does have these games and loves it very much,actually he has it on ps1 and ps2,he really enjoys his games.

LOWRIEK@... wrote:In a message dated 12/04/2003 17:24:08 Pacific Daylight Time,
Debbies4@... writes:


> Does anyone have the Harry Potter Sorcerer's Stone video game? What
> is your child's opinion of it?
>
>

We have this one, and it is very popular around here. The kids all gather
around and play it and have fun and enjoy the challenge. They also have the
new one now, and enjoy it also.
Nancy in BC

messages.messageBody:
myfunny4 wrote:

> The kids were so great while Kevin and I were in the hospital that I
> picked up the new Harry Potter: Chamber of Secrets DVD for them today
> at Wal-mart. Only $14.77...I remember when you couldn't buy a DVD
> for less than $25.00.
>
> Does anyone have the Harry Potter Sorcerer's Stone video game? What
> is your child's opinion of it?
>

The kids liked it but I found its lack of fire-power boring. Plus I was hopeless at the jumps and the fake accents grated. but aprt from that it was fun for a bit.

Shyrley

messages.subject: Oh my
messages.msgSnippet: I had to leave the list temporarily. Kevin went into the hospital on March 7, and we didn t come home until April 1.  I just skimmed over the past two days of
messages.messageBody:
I had to leave the list temporarily. Kevin went into the hospital on
March 7, and we didn't come home until April 1. I just skimmed over
the past two days of messages. Ouch. Some of it made me
laugh...kind of like when a Christian friend confided in me that she
felt comfortable with me even though I was Catholic.

The kids were so great while Kevin and I were in the hospital that I
picked up the new Harry Potter: Chamber of Secrets DVD for them today
at Wal-mart. Only $14.77...I remember when you couldn't buy a DVD
for less than $25.00.

Does anyone have the Harry Potter Sorcerer's Stone video game? What
is your child's opinion of it?

Debbie
